intro: Kadsura billitonensis, commonly known as the Billiton kadsura, is a species of flowering plant native to the Indonesian island of Sumatra. It belongs to the Aristolochiaceae family, characterized by its unique and often intricate floral structures. The plant is notable for its heart-shaped, dark green leaves and its fragrant, tubular flowers that resemble a snake or other animals, a feature common in the genus Kadsura. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in lowland and hill forest areas. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Kadsura billitonensis is considered an endangered species.
